        Actions to take after collisions were checked for, This simply adds Vectors to the position
        Parameters:
        character - moving object whose position should be updated

      • moveLeft

        public static void moveLeft(QMControls character)
        Makes character move left, Character will never exceed it's max given velocity, and will accelerate by factor of accelerate while on ground and factor of air friction while in air
        Parameters:
        character - object that you want to move left

      • moveRight

        public static void moveRight(QMControls character)
        Makes character move right, Character will never exceed it's max given velocity, and will accelerate by factor of accelerate while on ground and factor of air friction while in air
        Parameters:
        character - object that you want to move right

        public static void rest(QMControls character)
        If character is not moving left or right then we decelerate him
        Parameters:
        character - that stopped moving

      • horizontalCollision

        public static int horizontalCollision(QMBox character,
                      QBox wall)
        Checks to see if character's sides have collision with the given wall object
        Parameters:
        character - object which you want to check collision of
        wall - object with which you want to check collision
        Returns:
        LEFT if character's left side has collided with the wall RIGHT if character's right side has collided with the wall NONE if no collision happened

      • verticalCollision

        public static int verticalCollision(QMBox character,
                    QBox wall)
        Checks to see if character's top and bottom have collision with the given wall object
        Parameters:
        character - object which you want to check collision of
        wall - object with which you want to check collision
        Returns:
        DOWN if character's bottom side has collided with the wall (he landed) RIGHT if character's top side has collided with the wall (his head hit the ceiling) NONE if no collision happened

      • horizontalCollision

        public static int horizontalCollision(QMBox character1,
                      QMBox character2)
        Checks for collision of character1'1 sides against character2
        Parameters:
        character1 - movable object whose collision you want to check for
        character2 - movable object whose collisiono you want to check character2 against
        Returns:
        LEFT if chaacter1's left side hits character2, RIGHT if character1's right side hits character2 NONE if no side collision happens

      • verticalCollision

        public static int verticalCollision(QMBox character1,
                    QMBox character2)
        Check for collision of character1's top and bottom against character2
        Parameters:
        character1 - movable object whose collision you want to check
        character2 - movable object whose collision you want to check against
        Returns:
        DOWN if character1's feet hit character2's head UP if character2's feet hit character1's head NONE if no vertical collision happens

        character2 - movable object whose collision you want to check against

      • collision

        public static boolean collision(QBox wall1,
                QBox wall2)
        Checks to see if the objects have already collided
        Parameters:
        wall1 - first object that will be used in collision checking
        wall2 - second object that will be used in collision checking
        Returns:
        true if the object have collided and false if they didn't

      • random

        public static int random(int min,
         int max)
        Returns a random number using Math.random method. Using Random class is better, but if it is just one time occurrence and you do not want to create a class then use this method.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum number you want.
        max - The maximum number you want.
        Returns:
        Random number between the ranges of min and max.
